package-manager.name: pkgadd
package-manager.title: Apache Web Server
package-manager.description: The Apache Project is a collaborative software development effort aimed at creating a robust, commercial-grade, featureful, and freely-available source code implementation of an HTTP (Web) server.

item.para: Apply patch to fix CAN-2004-0786 (http://www.cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CAN-2004-0786), an input validation issue in IPv6 literal address parsing which can result in a negative length parameter being passed to memcpy.

Apply patch to fix CAN-2004-0747 (http://www.cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CAN-2004-0747), a buffer overflow in configuration file parsing that could allow a local user to gain the privileges of a httpd child if the server can be forced to parse a carefully crafted .htaccess file.

Apply patch to fix CAN-2004-0751 (http://www.cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CAN-2004-0751), a segfault in mod_ssl which can be triggered by a malicious remote server, if proxying to SSL servers has been configured.

Apply patch to fix CAN-2004-0748 (http://www.cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CAN-2004-0748), a potential infinite loop in mod_ssl which could be triggered given particular timing of a connection abort.
Apply patch to fix CAN-2004-0809 (http://www.cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CAN-2004-0809), a segfault in mod_dav_fs which can be remotely triggered by an indirect lock refresh request.

Apply patch to fix CAN-2004-0786 (http://www.cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CAN-2004-0786), an input validation issue in IPv6 literal address parsing which can result in a negative length parameter being passed to memcpy.

Apply patch to fix CAN-2004-0809 (http://www.cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CAN-2004-0809), a segfault in mod_dav_fs which can be remotely triggered by an indirect lock refresh request.
Upgrade config files from previous 2.0.x releases

Force early linkage of PCRE library so the PCRE regcomp(), regexec(), regerror(), and regfree() entries are picked up rather than the entries in libc. Fix for mod_rewrite bug on HP-UX (cf bug #26088).
Disable IPv6 and getaddrinfo(), getnameinfo(), gai_strerror() on IRIX to work with older 6.5.x releases

Apply patch for CAN-2004-0488 to fix a stack buffer overflow in mod_ssl which can be triggered if using the FakeBasicAuth option. If mod_ssl is sent a client certificate with a subject DN field longer than 6000 characters, a stack overflow can occur if FakeBasicAuth has been enabled. In order to exploit this issue the carefully crafted malicious certificate would have to be signed by a Certificate Authority which mod_ssl is configured to trust. http://www.cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CAN-2004-0488

Apply patch for CAN-2004-0493 to fix remotely triggered memory leak in http header parsing which can allow a denial of service attack due to excessive memory consumption (http://www.cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CAN-2004-0493)
